tdNU40nFQTzLV_1eTpuHXA.text: Siam Central is the best Thai food on Charlotte St. No questions asked. Perfect flavours in every meal every time. The jasmine flowering tea was a first for me - very impressive touch. Everything I've ever had there is amazing, but the pad thai there is particularly amazing - check it out.

V6J9koGZbeAmHZoAMjCvvg.text: This is one of my favourite thai places. The food is really amazing, especially the veggie parcels, pad si ew, and curries. I am vegetarian, but my friend really loved their special duck dish. I always bring friends here, think the service is good and efficient and the ambiance quite nice.

lYevVHhVId43hJIPQ9IaSg.text: Started with crispy chicken wings which I really liked - they're served with sweet chili sauce (which I don't like but I just didn't use it). I ordered the chilli and basil stir fry with pork as a main, and it was massive! Really really spicy, but with great fresh basil flavor, and the green beans and sugar snap peas were cooked perfectly - tender but still crisp. They call this the express lunch menu, and that is an accurate description - we were in and out of there in under an hour.

W3Dk_PI5vajDornGHF-khQ.text: Just ate here tonight after reading these suggestions and it was fantastic! Really wonderful place, great atmosphere, quick service, food came within minutes and it was DELICIOUS. If I lived in London, I would be eating here almost every day. I definitely suggest going to this place if you're looking for a good, not too expensive Thai meal - it's truly wonderful!

PMic7MU146T1RgFy-ijRNQ.text: We went to Siam central at a quiet time I think (around 5.3opm). It's a very small place. A bar in the middle and small tables around the edge. Some seating outside but overlooking a narrow pavement and busy street so I wouldn't realy fancy sitting outside to be honest. Not very private. The staff were helpful and friendly and the food came so quick I thought we hadn't ordered yet! They do a tapas kind of menu and you can also order a la carte. We tried both methods. Portion sizes where reasonable and so were the prices. We had the drunken seafood rice (as reommended by another reviewer) and it was delicious. We also tried the Satay chicken. Nothing special but it came with a decent, non salty peanut sauce and another syrupy sauce, both of which were delicious. We also had the Asparagus and scallops (very tasty), and an Aubergine dish (don't eat those green things, they aint peas!!!). All in all, pretty nice experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Aubergine and Chicken
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Drunken Seafood rice
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Asparagus and Scallops (left) and Satay Chicken (right)

pXuO7YKGRkR3N6-oacyIvA.text: Highly recommended this place to anyone who craving for a decent Thai food in London and happen to be around the area. This place is great for a thai food. I prefer this place more than Thai Metro. The taste of this place remind me of the taste of Thailand. Actually, i'm from thailand and trust me this place worth a visit.

NlKpE71a_wHT0XNYler1YQ.text: light years ahead of it's sister, Thai Metro, which is right down the street. i'm a regular.  the most solid thai food i've had in london so far, though a bit on the greasy side.  i stick with the tofu pad thai.  i'm a picky orderer...but they've yet to mix up my dish so no complaints.  service is fast, and friendly--depending on who you get. tried to write a fair review, but a worrying trend worth note is rude customer service towards certain patrons...not a good look. as a regular, though, this kind of 'welcome' is thoroughly unappreciated so i've begun to limit my visits.

fJzIMpKkyRrWR6GW5r0LoQ.text: This has be one of my favourite Thai resturants. Although the place is quite small and compact, it is always busy and sometimes you have to wait a while to be seated. However, the food is extraordinary, you can choose tapas or choose from their main menu. The food is delicious and my favourite has to be the drunken fried rice.

D-K7BGcRYhIL1ouWFCFRBA.text: This is a really nice restaurant. Its has great food and the staff are really nice. Its the sister company for Thai Metro which is also on Charlotte Street and thats also great.

TYOhX2S4uRlvLwQig0N4Kg.text: Thai food is my favorite food and I have to say that Siam Central is probably my favorite place to get Thai food in London.  It is as close to eating at the home of a Thai friend as you can get. Homemade food made with love for a small group is always better than mass quantities of food made for the public, but this food is still amazing. Order the pineapple fried rice, which comes in an actual pineapple and is full of shrimp and veggies. They will make your Jungle Curry (which can be hot enough to burn your tastes buds off) to your tastes if you need it a little milder. The menu is more traditional than some of the other Thai restaurants in London; authenticity is what I am looking for when I want Thai food. If you are just looking for a good curry on the other had you can always try Thai Metro the sister restaurant to Siam Central. All of the restaurants along Charlotte Street are packed with people on a warm summers night and they will usually open up their windows and doors, which creates a great atmosphere.

Wgdlgvf9hSEzVET-ylN0Ew.text: A cozy welcoming Thai restaurant with good quality Thai food. The restaurant competes with many others on the street but I'm glad we chose it. We ordered Thai fish cakes for starters, followed by Lamb Massaman curry, Chicken Pad Med and Morning Glory vegetables all to share. The meal was full of a medley of really tasty flavours and spices and the Massaman curry was really delicious and creamy. Service was fast and the setting was relaxing. A good place for a romantic meal or for dinner with friends. A solid Thai restaurant worth a visit.

mLs-xJ_2dDcsOiDKcffS-g.text: It's not much to look at from the outside, but don't let that put you off. The food is nicely presented, super-tasty and won't break the bank (two of us had starter, main course and a couple of beers for under £40).One thing to note - booking is advised. We turned up on spec (early evening) and got the last unreserved table. Judging by the number of parties they had to turn away, Siam Central is pretty popular!

iiBy662rvLNsRc8q54UitA.text: Best Thai I've had in London. Quick service. Flavorful food....supremely spicy. Convenient location with quick takeaway.

ranVlRZDruBI7BXtmOhn-A.text: Small restaurant and food is good. The Green curry is amazing as is the pineapple rice.

THvUSR_jy6Y1r7EcmcmAAg.text: My friend took me here for a late dinner on a Saturday night.  He claims that it is one of the best Thai food places in London, and he's right!  The place is small and cute, and the wait staff was fast and efficient.  Simple menu but they serve amazing food!  We started with mussels, and that was fine (nothing to complain about).  We then had the pineapple fried rice with chicken, and it came in a pineapple (how cool is that)!  That was delicious; the rice was sticky and had a sweet taste to it!  The beef drunken noodle was made perfectly, not too oily and hit the spot.And it was probably one of the cheaper meals I've had in London.  Awesome!

DtDF9aZf4hrYc5GPNMmYMA.text: Nice spot for an inexpensive dinner. 3 people - 3 beers, 3 curry orders, and 2 appetizers = 45 pounds. Not bad for London! The food was average / good and the staff were very friendly. The tamarind duck was an excellent starter but the papaya salad was a bit lacking. Both red and green curry had a nice kick!

wcpLxqJ8P5PtE3WKxZfDeA.text: I don't usually like spicy but I keep coming back for their curries. Every time I regret asking for something spicy whilst at the same time loving every bite and leaving to plate clean.

3herefTn6-FOpU_NuSggaw.text: Nice place for good Thai food at great value. Every dishes were very tasty and I am highly recommend the Siam tapas combo. Definitely worth a try.

uYukX2t3YlX4C4RP2UmIxg.text: I first went here for dinner with friends and had great fun. Subsequently I've been back for lunches, and a big birthday dinner last week,I really enjoyed the Pad Thai the first time around. It was just as it should be - not too heavy, slightly moist and full of citrus. The lunchtime menu is great - providing a starter and 'main' for a set price. I forget how much exactly, but it's something close to £7 (which for a two-course hot meal isn't bad). The main meals themselves are the same price when ordering from the main menu. We sat downstairs on Tuesday for a dinner for about 12 people. The staff coped with us all well, and our food came out quickly but with no corners cut. NB. The tom yam soup with mushroom is to die for. I have it pretty much every time I go.

YnVTS2_34H9K863R9psfJg.text: Great Thai, quick service.  And you can often tell where good Thai is when you are the only one NOT speaking Thai eating there!  Enjoy!

jOnyVS2A6zki1lTjMAV5wQ.text: What a great cheap eat on Charlotte Street. I highly recommend the drunken rice or noodles for a carb fuelled delicious lunch.

oc-7ax5tPIElvoku5dY-cw.text: Tried Siam Central for lunch today. Nothing exceptional but generally good food for a good price (had a chicken curry with orange juice for £7). Worth giving it a go for lunch. But maybe not if you're in a hurry though. Service was slow for us and not really organised. The girl next to us also ordered 20mn before us and we had our food before her. Then again, looking at all the great reviews above, I may have come at the wrong time!

8ZPTUSRwXt5Y7GdmRAT7Eg.text: The fact that Siam Central is my local has nothing to do with anything. Living in the West End, we're surrounded by numerous and sundry restaurants, a significant number of them Thai. There's Thai Metro (bland), Busaba Eathai (no desserts!) and even Soho Thai, which I thought was ok. But nothing actually comes close to Siam Central ~ not in taste, price and consistent delivery of a brilliant product. Siam Central also has a unique Thai tapas menu ~ a collection of small dishes to share, including tamarind duck (topped with tamarind and palm sugar), flash fried tofu (with fried slices of garlic) and chicken & prawn toast. Other interesting tapas style dishes include weeping tiger (seasoned beef sirloin with soy chilli sauce), spiced salted squid and Singha beer battered seafood. Mains at Siam Central are more traditionally Thai ~ we shared a pineapple fried rice, duck panang curry, chicken pad thai and a chilli & basil stir fry with beef. One word I can think of to describe their food is flavoursome, because that's what it is  nothing is ever bland and everything is infused so beautifully with herbs and spices that you just breathe in the goodness before diving in for a full mouthful that doesn't. ever. disappoint. Another great thing about Siam Central is their choice of desserts, from fried ice cream to coconut crepes (pandan crepes filled with dessicated coconut), chilled mango mousse and even fresh mango with sticky rice when the season allows (ie not right now in this never ending winter we're having). I always order the coconut crepes because my tastebuds dictate me to. I do have to admit though, a couple of times they've cooked the crepe a touch too long so it's almost crispy (bad) but done right, this is one of those desserts that make you feel like you're sitting by the street side at Patong Beach, slurping up deathly hot tom yum soup, and cooling your flaming mouth on the local sweets. Anyway no website  tick. No PR to speak of  tick. But a queue every weekend night? Surely people who know know, and we're onto a good thing. Make sure you make a reservation if you plan to dropping by, especially on a weekend. And enjoy!

H2UdncXB4QPUEXxfuO8gHw.text: I had an excellent dinner there. The staff was pleasant and as we arrived early (around 7.30 pm), we did not have to wait for a long time. We liked the black wooden furniture and the calm atmosphere. The restaurant had everything of a lounge bar. The food was perfect, and not so pricey. First you have a choice of thaï tapas as starters, such as fried seafood (around £6 per person). The shrimps were delicious! I had the greatest "Pad Thai Chicken" of my life. The noodles were very tasty. I enjoyed the dessert too (coconut pancakes)although it was a little hard to bite. I recommend this adress!

0CyVhAU919iT7MmCo0lB4Q.text: Wouldn't rate it as highly as previous reviewers, though I'm sure in the summer there's a bit more space. The 3 of us were seated at a small table right next to the toilets and whilst the food was pretty decent and not hugely expensive (main, rice and dessert was about £15) it wasn't anything amazing. Still, no real complaints and it was perfectly pleasant.

glxVL8Wak2AcSOvTO-VF6w.text: Nice food n affordable price! highly recommend the red curry with duck and pineapple fried rice.

gyqlKpptJ7cHH0hz5fTaFg.text: Came here yesterday evening because Thai Metro was "full". Glad I did because I now like Siam Central much better! The place is very small and packed but then again, this is the West End and space is at an absolute premium. We had the seafood combo platter (for 2): beer battered mussels, prawns in breadcrumbs, spicy fish cakes, battered salmon fillets and jumbo prawns at £6.75 per person. The 2 person platter which arrived consisted exactly 2 of the described items and wasn't that big. However it made up for that in terms of freshness, texture and taste and is recommended. We also had a papaya salad (som tam) which was fresh, tart and very tasty (though not the slightly mashed type typically found in Thailand). I would certainly return here to try their main dishes. Services was keen, unobtrusive and efficient, which was good.

XRHTCR5eZOw6l3EBUwudxw.text: I like it here, but it's not Busaba. And dammit I really really really love Busaba. But this place is closer to my office and you can get a table quicker so I don't complain. This is the other part to the Thai Metro chain. (That's a couple of doors up.) I don't know if there's a difference. They guys are convinced that this branch is nicer, and more expensive but I couldn't tell. This one may look less 'budget', but it's charlotte street, it's never going to look too shabby is it? So here's the deal: Order off the lunch menu, get some yummy thai curry, eat thai curry, go back to office. There's nothing that makes you want to stick around, but the food is good. There's worse places, I like it here. But it's not exactly blowing me away, despite the amount of chilli they add to their food. On that note, if someone could bring me glass of water I asked for next time, that'd be nice. I didn't push them, I drank my work mates beer instead, but why do they always forget your water? Only three stars for that, despite lunch only costing £6

wn61nlEup2whZSpl-Jv1-Q.text: very very tasty Thai food.. great prices and amazing flavor the best thai I have been to in London without being super portentous, just a great place to eat amazing thai!

nuDo5-1A-SWv0cLEvjk-mQ.text: This was one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had at a restaurant. Upon coming in, we were immediately informed that they will be very busy and will not have enough seats, so we only had 1.5 hours to eat our meal and then get out. Even though we gave several looks of shock to the waitress, she kept pointing at her watch and repeating the same information for another 15 minutes. We were completely surprised with such mistreatment and were about to leave if not for our friends who were meeting us at the place. Ultimately, the restaurant never got full and we left outraged at such unprofessional and inferior service. NEVER coming back. They deserve to close.

cHHK9b6FvudM1td5TzkfTA.text: fine and average thai food, nothing really special about it.

36qXkKEkdau6tqD7nLzpeg.text: This is a great place to rest your weary shopping feet or line the stomach for a big night ahead.Decent food that comes out fast, excellent service and perfect portion sizes. The fish cakes had the right amount of kick and the curry and noodle dishes were both good. The 'morning glory' greens seems slightly oily so perhaps go with the seasonal veg option instead.

6d729UUrNx-WMFRSdEy-kg.text: Delicious and affordable Thai food. The 2 and 3 courses meal sets at lunch are very good value for money! Love the prawn&chicken toast, the chicken wings and pad-mee noodles.

giyEXdBrqjtJjnSconNXFg.text: Fantastic Thai food! The drunken noodle dish was excellent. Food wasn't as spicy as other Thai food I've eaten but still delicious.

bkIA3QvNc99UEtn-AVO_uw.text: This is an ideal restaurant to have a tasty meal with a beer on a Friday night, for a good price. It's a short walk from Goodge St tube station.We arrived at about 7:30pm and the restaurant looked full. We were acknowledged and invited to wait for two minutes for a table. Indeed, two minutes later, we were invited to go downstairs where we were met by another staff member who showed us to a free table. The tables are close together and ours had the residual stickiness of a place where a number of people had already dined tonight.We also chose the mixed selection of starters.  This had the usual things that you would expect: prawn toast, satay chicken, etc.  My favourite is the prawn toast which I save for the end as a kind of "starter dessert".  We ordered two main-sized dishes to share: Penang curry with duck and Pad Thai with chicken. My wife was attracted to the green papaya salad on the menu, so we ordered that too.  I liked how the Pad Thai came with the chopped peanuts and bean sprouts on the side, so you could control your allocation. It works for me because I like the peanuts but don't like the bean sprouts. The duck slices in the curry were cooked as I like it.The overall bill was a touch over £40 including 10% service charge.  This is pretty reasonable for a Friday night dinner out in London.

x4-aeiuvFn81W7b00VmnEg.text: Ordinary Thai food. Some dishes smell a bit eggy but not too much. Downstairs seating is a bit dark. It's a good place for a work lunch upstairs.

y8MXcNWj8A8gRtv1Y9jGYA.text: This is a solid place for lunch. Their set menu for £8 provides great value. The service is good as it's a pretty small restaurant so they do care about table turnover. I've had the drunken fried rice here which is super flavorful without being greasy and friends have had the pad thai and the pineapple fried rice, which are also very good. They have some tables outside if you can manage to get a table.

_JFhC8zBWjkHamb8tgI1Nw.text: Siam Central is an affordable Thai restaurant that sells delicious food in the heart of Fitzrovia. Healthy portions, great atmosphere, lovely staff and speedy service. Try the drunken noodles!

re-HbmZ4kAm8VsKYZaoPnA.text: This good review is based on lunch service experience. I found that the food we had was tasteful and affordable. I had the panang curry with tofu which was served in a good size bowl, cupful of rice and side salad for £6. My husband on the other hand had the pad thai with chicken breast for the same price. Great deal in my opinion!!! Also it is also notable that this place was quite prompt in serving your food to those who have limited time to dine out. It was definitely quality time spent on this place.

uCWKsjBQquJzXJHw5oQBWw.text: We have walked past this place on numerous occassion, asked for a table but it is usually completely packed and we didn't want to wait. This time we were lucky that we could be seated straight away (with only 1 empty table). The customer service was fab. I explained we're in a rush (we literally had 30 mins to order, eat & pay before the movie started). The food arrived at a good time (not so fast that they nuked the food). We loved the salt & pepper squid as well as the chicken satay. If a Thai restaurant can't make a good chicken satay, then there is no hope. My partner orderd a Mussaman Chicken Curry whilst I had the Thick Rice noodle with duck. The main was good, but not excellent.I still cannot decide whether I prefer Busaba to Siam Central. They are both as good although during the meal I sensed that they may have used MSG in their food. I'm not a fan of MSG, hence the 3 star. If you're in the area... give it a go. We will be trying the Thai Metro to compare the two :)

u__4GhpQBLMC7UjNHa1tCQ.text: As well as the chicken being halal, the food was delectable. Cute location and not overpriced.  It may just be a starter but the prawn chicken toast is not to be missed (they served 4 toasts but we ate 2 before taking the picture). I'd also recommend the drunken fried rice as that's their speciality. On the other table I saw an interesting looking papaya salad which I will be sure to check out next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Drunken fried rice, Thai green curry and prawn toasts

oA5Kv82mXFUgTZwd1p0CzQ.text: Siam Central is one of the most happening restaurants in hip Fitzrovia. The line on weekends is long, but that is not surprising given the popularity of this joint. The Pad Tai and Drunken Noodles are amazing, as is the Pineapple Shrimp curry, which is served in a half cut pineapple shell.Service is fast. However this place is pricey and the waiters don't speak much English to help recommend a favorite.Still, for those buds craving some Thai, it doesn't get much better than this.

3PaPVILLkLmVodPKamIlzw.text: I wanted some Thai food, and this restaurant was recommended by my sister who used to eat here all the time. I ordered a thick noodle dish with chicken and vegetables. Delicious! There was lots of chicken, and good amount of veggies, but a small portion of noodles. It was nicely flavoured with soy and added lime, which added more taste to the dish. I would be more happy if they added more noodles, but everything used in the dish tasted very light and fresh. The staff were polite and friendly. For someone like myself from Canada, the restaurant looks and feels more like an European café, but it's the food that really matters. I would definately go back to this restaurant if I wanted some Thai in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom

ccGsKtwmgy-hCexNTl0PeQ.text: This Thai restaurant has everything going for it, excellent dishes, friendly staff and a superb location on Charlotte Street. As a huge fan of Thai Green Curries, (one of the only dishes I ate when I was in Thailand), I like to think i know a good one when I taste it. This is by far the best one I've had in London.. Worth a visit for the Thai green curry alone! Oh and the Morning Glory and Coconut/Sticky Rice are also excellent..

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Thai Green Curry
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Rice
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Salad

NhDXuHOqLEqT_tp_cvzDtA.text: Reasonably priced and authentic Thai cuisine.  Great meal if you like that food, go for it!

RixqPXrQ13Qx3fk_S8Krlg.text: Good, cheap Thai food. The green curry was surprisingly (a little too) spicy, but the food was of a good quality, very cheap and VERY quick (we ordered, and it arrived in fewer than ten minutes). Would highly recommend.

uyn8oS0EnSjHSkef8lFJiw.text: DinnerI had green curry, may be spent less than £15 so not so much to be picky but nothing unique either. Not sure if I want to go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom

_QonxrVTYLbuaatuSZPhMw.text: Awesome place. A quaint little restaurant that's reasonably priced and has the quickest and the friendliest service I've experienced for a long time. The food is amazing and we found that, on the whole the dishes were a tad spicier than other Thai restaurants, which is no bad thing! Also, the drunken fried rice is a must have! Great for a casual eating out and even more formal occasions, the atmosphere was great and even the toilets smelt really nice! Left feeling stuffed and thoroughly looked after! Couldn't recommend enough!

tgR9EKayOH0ZXY_Myav9-A.text: Another great Thai place near Goodge street station. Recommend if you are in the area.Great flavours, tasty & fresh.

xAOboT6IkQ610YQoyTacTw.text: Hands down ranks as one of the top 3 Thai restaurants that I have ever been to (outside of Thailand, of course).  I'm reluctant to even try any other Thai restaurant in London now that I've stumbled on to Siam Central.  I have come here twice (both times for lunch), and the food has been consistently amazing.  Even after finishing off my own meal, I'm often eyeing the dishes on neighbouring tables.  Every plate is chock-full of bright, savoury colours, and the appearance certainly does not belie the taste.  I would easily try anything on SC's menu, so I don't see much point in recommending any particular dish, but for the sake of risk-averse restaurant go-ers, I'll vouch for the Tom Yum soup (spicy enough to give you a kick but not too spicy that it numbs your experience of other flavours) and Gaeng Karee Gai.  Besides the great food, Siam Central is very good value.  It is priced like most other casual thai restaurants (6-8 pounds for a main), but offers way more value in terms of both the quality of food & the atmosphere.  You won't find yourself sitting in a dining room cluttered with cheesy Buddha and elephant statuettes.  This restaurant keeps it nice and simple, with a modern European twist on thai decor.Suffices to say that I will hit Siam Central any time I feel a craving for thai....

oDfSQDSsAZY563PrTXwxdw.text: Stopped by for dinner on a Thursday night on the way home and it was really busy but the owner made it work! We were able to get seated outside (which was lovely because it was a really nice night) and he adjusted the tables accordingly so that we could put our buggy next to us. My little boy slept through dinner, so it was perfect. - Thai Iced Tea: delicious and sweeter than usual, which I liked. But...twas a small glass so it was all gone by the time our food arrived. Haha. - Chicken Skewers: pretty good. Would've preferred maybe a sweeter peanut sauce, but it was still good. - Pineapple Fried Rice: really good and came in the pineapple, so presentation was lovely. - Pad Thai: also tasty. It was quite a lot of food for two people, so there was plenty of leftovers. When I reheated the pineapple fried rice a day later, it was still really really good.Overall, we had a good experience. The food was good but I mostly appreciated the service from the owner / manager at accommodating us.

UDA0KL87jeiZv6zpbQMTRw.text: A friend brought me here for a quick Wednesday night dinner and I was surprised to see the restaurant packed full! It was an omen of the good food to come. I tried their garlic broccoli which was perfectly cooked - not too mushy - and seasoned well. The drunken noodles were delicious too. Spicy and loaded up with fresh veg. They had lots of vegetarian options which is always a bonus for me. Quick service, noce cosy ambience and really delicious food. Cannot wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian drunken noodles
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Broccoli with garlic and soy sauce

3DHwR3PeIOj0hZEwJWb1PA.text: Stopped by for dinner on a weeknight; it was crowded both up and downstairs so we sat outside at the heated tables and were quite comfortable even though it was chilly outside.Our food came out very quickly, but I think our server forgot us after that since we were the only ones outside.I had the drunken fried rice with chicken which was mildly spicy. Husband had Pad See Ew, which was good, but not spicy so you need to ask for chili order to add in yourself.Definitely recommend.

GI-RjjBkBoGT733ZZHq6rQ.text: Wasn't particularly hungry while dining out with friends but we all enjoyed our food. I ordered the thom yum soup with seafood and coconut milk as well as the thai tea. I was very happy with my choices. There was a slightly grumpy manager lurking about but we all laughed it off.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Thai tea; pretty art

hIsu6PqE-r2DtsBwZgYNbQ.text: My friends and I came here on our first visit to Charlotte street and had a great lunch! The staff was very accommodating for our larger group of five in getting us seated and with separate checks. We three of my friends had the drunken noodles, one had pineapple fried rice and I had pad thai. Everything was surprisingly tasty! My dish tasted slightly smokey, so I wonder if they left it in the wok for too long. Anyways, we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Pad thai

DeBY4V5gALiddS7dU85Rog.text: This place is situated on a street with soooo many other amazing looking restaurants. Competition baby! Anyway, back to Siam.My husband and I finally decided on this place because it had a table outside and we were wanting Thai. It was so sweet- we sat at a nice little table right off the street and the sun was setting. We had the veggie spring rolls- boooomb! (that means really really good) and the Green curry and Thai basil with prawns. Both had excellent flavours and were loaded with shrimp and veggies. Amazing! It was clear they brought them out right when they were ready- all the food was piping hot, crunchy (spring rolls), and oh so good. We were happy puppies. We had trouble choosing a favourite, both were excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Chili Thai basil
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Green curry
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Veggie spring rolls

muJhWOwt3FFkNfF-gRql5w.text: Their Thai tea is so good! Sweet and milky with a slight chocolaty flavour! Also had their green curry. Slightly spicy but real creamy and good. My friend personally recommends the fried rice here.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom

vLUntJLDrY8tslnZ5RksxA.text: Love Love Love! We had the jungle curry (spicy), roti with curry sauce and basil chicken. Yum - yum!

x2RLTHqQzOwUVZlSwZlSzQ.text: Fantastic Thai food, great staff, cute venue.I booked a table for 8 for a pre-theatre meal, the upstairs part is quite small but they also have a second, large dining room downstairs. The staff was super friendly and seated us immediately. Drinks were ordered and arrived very timely. Everyone found something they liked on the menu and food came out quite quickly. They even asked which items we wanted as starters and which as mains so we could all eat together, whether we ordered full meals or dim sum style small plates. I got to try several dishes and everything was delicious. The curries are a bit on the too-spicy side for me, but I'm not a fan of spicy foods to begin with. I really can't complain about anything here!

O9baV5dqzEhh06L4SJUFpQ.text: Really enjoyed my drunken rice dish - so so so good. The veggie platter for starters was a bit too deep fried and blah-ring for me. We also shared between three of us, a cashew stir fry that was bit dull for my tastes and a veggie noodle dish that was very tastyo. BUT oh that drunken rice!  The way the tofu tasted in that one was divine. The restaurant looks small but do not be deceived there is a big downstairs. Came to around £14 each.

gh4Mnmqw00Js5xghoQX1hw.text: The food is just fantastic but the service is horrible. The servers look like they don't want to be there and getting service is a 20 minute ordeal. It's a shame because food is 5 star.

ERec-GFFx5yfdj53sXIuQg.text: I ordered delivery -- three drunken noodles of both prawns and beef.Food was solid. I asked mine to be made extra spicy, and they definitely delivered on that dimension. Seafood and meat in the dishes were generally fresh. I also liked the proportion of ingredients overall. Delivery was prompt and the delivery man, kind. The owner that took my order over the phone also seemed attentive and orderly. Would definitely order delivery again from here!

Yij8rEQUye6RBfzlWgzrwA.text: Not a big restaurant, but then again most restaurants in London are not big. That's just how it works around there. Or here. Depending where I am when you are reading this.I came here with my favorite London couple and I was the third wheel, though I am married so technically we were a proper car...it just so happened that one of the wheels was somewhere far away.Service was very fast, almost frighteningly fast. Not super nice, but fast. I had chicken pad thai and it was about as good as I was expecting it to be.Basically, this place is fine. I'd choose the good at Metro Thai or Thai Metro or whatever it is called, down the street. It's a little better.Bonus: if you ask for extra water, they may just leave the pitcher at your table. Convenient...but not too polite.

qjaL1sviB2r9hb8CymcXwQ.text: Tasty food at very reasonable prices. Great lunch specials too!We went with the two course lunch specials. Corn fritters, pork and shrimp dumplings, pad see ewe, and veggie and tofu stir fry. The pork and shrimp dumplings were not too exciting but the rest of the dishes were great. One of the better Thai places around and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom

gS7HsJ5QxieA2Z-ffPenQA.text: Incredible food. Started with chicken and prawn toast with sesame seeds on top that came with a sweet chili sauce, which was a must order, and spring rolls. We ordered the drunken rice which was super flavorful and spicy and the green curry with chicken that was incredible also. Everything we had was amazing and I definitely would recommend this awesome Thai place!!!

K0zmwtjcQ-Rz1OIfHpzJWA.text: Pretty cheap, good southeast asian food.  It's a smallish restaurant, so if you're going in a larger group, I would make a reservation.  They have more than just Thai food.  You can find Singaporean and Malaysian food as well.

calZBR66mZLDE71pg9wuIA.text: Cute little place by the University of London. The portion for lunch was great but the actual food was just ok. There was some sort of spice missing from it that I can't quite place. There was probably more egg than chicken in my dish. You can get a main course for 6£85 or an appetizer or dessert with a main course item for 8£85. No WiFi granted.

photos.caption: Photo of Siam Central - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Pad Thai

kyXf7Nz-AOiXERtlkfUTjw.text: Delicious, rapid service, intimate.. I recommend trying the tapas flights... Great way to sample some excellent bites. The mains are as you would expect, classic Thai dishes. The only reason I give four stars is that the spice level is not where I would like, and I was unable to communicate my preferences to the wait staff. Definitely worth a try, plenty of good food on the menus, and the prices are reasonable.

m0oVkCQOI0G_UFonHekeMA.text: This is a Thai place pretty close to where I go to school. I've come here numerous times with my classmates and I have to say I'm a fan. The place is a bit small at least the upper level of their place is relatively small but it's nice and cozy. The service is always great too! I've only ordered a few dishes here but each one I've ordered is GREAT! My favorites are the Drunken Noodle or the Drunken Fried Rice. Their lunch menu is definitely worth it! All in all you never pay that much and they have a mirad of choices to choose from for a dish. I believe I'm not the only one that feels this way because this place gets BUSY! I might go again this week. YUM.

mgj5FrknREU9wiIEGA93-w.text: Don't know what people are raving about. Got seated as a single person, they didn't seem to happy with me taking up space for 2.Didn't get the cassava crackers everyone had, maybe because I'm alone??Tom Kha Kai was below average, chewy chicken and the only vegetables were an onion and a few sad mushrooms.Ordered the coconut rice and stir fried aubergine with chili. Over cooked rice and aubergine, very bland taste.Maybe I am spoiled by Patara, but this was very disappointing.Total price was almost £20,- too much as well IMHO.For me just 2 stars, ambiance was not too good and food below average.
